guidelinename: CYP2D6, CYP2C19 and Selective Serotonin Reuptake Inhibitors

citations.title: Clinical Pharmacogenetics Implementation Consortium (CPIC) Guideline for CYP2D6 and CYP2C19 Genotypes and Dosing of Selective Serotonin Reuptake Inhibitors

implications.CYP2C19: Greatly reduced metabolism when compared to normal metabolizers. Higher plasma concentrations may increase the probability of side effects.

recommendations.drugrecommendation: Consider a 50% reduction of recommended starting dose and titrate to response or select alternative drug not predominantly metabolized by CYP2C19.
recommendations.comments: Drug-drug interactions and other patient characteristics (e.g., age, renal function, liver function) should be considered when selecting an alternative therapy. Percent dose adjustments corresponding to percent difference in oral clearances have been calculated/estimated by Stingl et al. (PMID 22565785).

implications.CYP2C19: Greatly reduced metabolism when compared to normal metabolizers. Higher plasma concentrations may increase the probability of side effects.

implications.CYP2C19: Increased metabolism when compared to normal metabolizers

recommendations.drugrecommendation: Initiate therapy with recommended starting dose. If patient does not respond to recommended maintenance dosing, consider alternative drug not predominantly metabolized by CYP2C19.
recommendations.comments: Drug-drug interactions and other patient characteristics (e.g., age, renal function, liver function) should be considered when selecting an alternative therapy.
